channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Israeli airstrike kills dozens in Rafah; raw milk under scrutiny
item.description: At least 35 people were killed and dozens more injured in an Israeli airstrike on an encampment in Rafah. As bird flu spreads among dairy cattle herds, raw milk is undergoing renewed scrutiny.
item.content:encoded:
At least 35 people were killed and dozens more injured in an Israeli airstrike on an encampment in Rafah. As bird flu spreads among dairy cattle herds, raw milk is undergoing renewed scrutiny.

(Image credit: Jehad Alshrafi/AP)

item.title: An Israeli airstrike killed 45 Palestinians in an encampment for displaced people
item.description: The Israeli military said it killed two Hamas militant leaders in the strike but Palestinian health officials say dozens of civilians who had sought shelter in an encampment were killed and injured.
item.content:encoded:
The Israeli military said it killed two Hamas militant leaders in the strike but Palestinian health officials say dozens of civilians who had sought shelter in an encampment were killed and injured.

(Image credit: Anas Baba)
item.dc:creator: Hadeel Al-Shalchi

item.title: Papua New Guinea tells the U.N. that a landslide buried more than 2,000 people
item.description: The government figure is roughly triple the U.N. estimate of victims killed in the South Pacific island nation's interior. Estimates of the casualties have varied widely since the disaster occurred.
item.content:encoded:
The government figure is roughly triple the U.N. estimate of victims killed in the South Pacific island nation's interior. Estimates of the casualties have varied widely since the disaster occurred.

(Image credit: Mohamud Omer/AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: The 3 ways Trump's hush money trial could end, as jury deliberations begin soon
item.description: Former U.S. Attorney Harry Litman breaks down three broad possible conclusions the jury could reach.
item.content:encoded:
Former U.S. Attorney Harry Litman breaks down three broad possible conclusions the jury could reach.

(Image credit: Curtis Means)
item.dc:creator: Tyler Bartlam

item.title: The new obesity drugs work, but it's a dilemma when people have to stop taking them
item.description: There are lots of reasons people have to stop taking the new weight loss drugs: cost, shortages, side effects and life events. And the weight usually comes back, doctors say.
item.content:encoded:
There are lots of reasons people have to stop taking the new weight loss drugs: cost, shortages, side effects and life events. And the weight usually comes back, doctors say.

(Image credit: Shelby Knowles)
item.dc:creator: Yuki Noguchi

item.title: Questions of Loyalty in Latvia
item.description: Russia's war in Ukraine is deepening divisions across Europe. One example is the Baltic nation of Latvia, formerly part of the Soviet Union. One third of those living in Latvia are Russian speaking and now some elderly residents, who may have lived there for decades, are being forced to prove their loyalty or leave.
item.content:encoded: Russia's war in Ukraine is deepening divisions across Europe. One example is the Baltic nation of Latvia, formerly part of the Soviet Union. One third of those living in Latvia are Russian speaking and now some elderly residents, who may have lived there for decades, are being forced to prove their loyalty or leave.
item.dc:creator: Philip Reeves

item.title: Witnessing the spectacle of synchronous fireflies is ‘like magic’
item.description: For a few weeks in late spring, thousands of fireflies emerge at the Congaree National Park in South Carolina to blink in synchrony. Scientists are trying to learn their secrets and to protect them.
item.content:encoded:
For a few weeks in late spring, thousands of fireflies emerge at the Congaree National Park in South Carolina to blink in synchrony. Scientists are trying to learn their secrets and to protect them.

(Image credit: Sam Wolfe for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Pien Huang

item.title: Air travel has gone to the dogs — literally. Here’s what to know about BARK Air
item.description: BARK Air says it built its experience "dog first," offering perks like puppucchinos and pheromone blankets. It's flying between New York and LA or London and plans to add more routes soon.
item.content:encoded:
BARK Air says it built its experience "dog first," offering perks like puppucchinos and pheromone blankets. It's flying between New York and LA or London and plans to add more routes soon.

(Image credit: Joe Gall)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: Aid trucks begin entering Gaza under agreement with Egypt to bypass Rafah
item.description: Aid trucks entered Gaza from southern Israel on Sunday through a new agreement to bypass the Rafah crossing with Egypt after Israeli forces seized the Palestinian side of it earlier this month.
item.content:encoded:
Aid trucks entered Gaza from southern Israel on Sunday through a new agreement to bypass the Rafah crossing with Egypt after Israeli forces seized the Palestinian side of it earlier this month.

(Image credit: Ariel Schalit/AP)
item.dc:creator: Associated Press

item.title: At least 5 dead in Texas after severe weather hits Texas and Oklahoma
item.description: At least two people are dead after severe weather swept across Texas and Oklahoma overnight, causing extensive damage and outages, authorities said.
item.content:encoded:
At least two people are dead after severe weather swept across Texas and Oklahoma overnight, causing extensive damage and outages, authorities said.

(Image credit: Roy Dabner/AP)
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
